title: What's the difference between air and oxygen? - Quora

response.answer_text: Oxygen is a pure substance, and also an element. It is the component of air which supports combustion. Air is a mixture of gases whose second major component (21% by volume) is oxygen, next to nitrogen. Argon and carbon dioxide are other important components of air. Combustible substances like wood burn vigorously and much more brightly in pure oxygen than in air, as only one-fifth of air is composed of oxygen. Air is slightly lighter than oxygen.

Air is the mixture of gases which makes up the environment in an area. It normally contains a mixture of oxygen, nitrogen, carbon dioxide, and other gases. However, it can be a completely different mixture on another planet, or in an enclosed space. Oxygen is an element, and the term is also used t refer to its chemical form, O2, hich has 2 oxygen atoms bonded to each other. It is the part of air we need to breath.

Air is the composition of all the gases that the above table shows. Oxygen is only present by ~ 21% by volume. This percentage is not local, it is on an average. If we test the oxygen percentage at industrial area, the amount of oxygen level would be less and when tested at places where there are more amount of trees, the amount of oxygen level will be more than 21%.

Air is a mixture is gases. Oxygen is a single gas made up of only oxygen molecules (O2]. Air has 78% nitrogen gas and 21% oxygen gas in it. It also has water vapor, carbon dioxide, argon and other things in it. Here's a link at NASA that talks about air. Air Properties Definitions

Air contains oxygen but oxygen although generically called air, does not contain air. Air in the atmosphere contains different gases in different percentages like Nitrogen is 78 %, Oxygen is 21%, Carbon dioxide, exhaust and waste gases make up the remaining 1 percent. Air is a mixture of gases, but oxygen is pure (just itself).

Oxygen, is only a component of the total gas composition of air. Methane gas coming from living and decaying organisms is one example. Methane is a green house gas as is carbon dioxide both responsible for Earth’s warming. The industrial revolution and commercial agriculture, mining, burning of vegetation, and wetlands are the main sources of these gases in the air mixture.

The air we breathe is a mixture that contains primarily oxygen and nitrogen. The nitrogen generally makes up approximately 78% of the air, while oxygen makes up 21%. Other gases including carbon dioxide, hydrogen, helium, argon, and neon make up the remainder. These gases dissolve and are carried in the blood

The difference between air and oxygen is… “the air we breathe is a mixture that contains primarily oxygen and nitrogen. The nitrogen generally makes up approximately 78% of the air, while oxygen makes up 21%. Other gases including carbon dioxide, helium, argon and neon make up the remainder. These gases dissolved and carried in the blood “. Thank you.
The difference between air and oxygen :- ●Air is a mixture of gases such as: Nitrogen,Oxygen,Carbon dioxide,Argon and many other gases . ●Oxygen is gas which is found in a pure state.

Ambient air is approximately 21% oxygen, 70% nitrogen, and 9% various other gasses and crud (smoke, ozone, farts, etc). Medical oxygen is about 95% pure oxygen. Welding oxygen is about 99% pure oxygen. (Yeah, go figure!)

The air we breathe (not including the various amounts of pollutants - exhaust fumes, cigarette smoke, etc.) is only 21 percent oxygen. Almost all the rest is nitrogen. Breathing pure oxygen could be as harmful as breathing air filled with harmful pollutants. The stuff is only good for us in small quantities.
More than three fourth of air is nitrogen. Only around fifth of air is oxygen. So air is mixture of various gases while oxygen is 100% oxygen.  Source: amazon.in
Air is comprised of many of the gases like oxygen 21%, nitrogen 78% and carbon di oxide 0.03% and other gases tooo… where as oxygen is only one gas naah…
